Trial_Design.evidence: We randomized patients who were at least 12 months after primary THA or TKA to complete a web-based followup or to have their appointment at the clinic.

Participants.evidence: There were 410 eligible patients contacted for the study during the recruitment period.

Intervention.evidence: We randomized patients who were at least 12 months after primary THA or TKA to complete a web-based followup or to have their appointment at the clinic.

Objective.evidence: We determined (1) patient satisfaction and (2) patients’ preferences for followup method (web-based or in-person) after total joint arthroplasty.

Method_Outcome.evidence: All 229 patients completed a satisfaction questionnaire at the time of their followup appointments.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: We randomized patients who were at least 12 months after primary THA or TKA to complete a web-based followup or to have their appointment at the clinic.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of these, 256 agreed to participate, and a total of 229 patients completed the study (89% of those enrolled, 56% of those potentially eligible; 111 in the usual-care group, 118 in the web-based group).

Number_Analysed.evidence: All 229 patients completed a satisfaction questionnaire at the time of their followup appointments.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Ninety-one patients (82.0%) in the usual-care group indicated that they were either extremely or very satisfied with the followup process compared with 90 patients (75.6%) who were in the web-based group (p < 0.01; odds ratio [OR] = 3.95; 95% CI, 1.79–8.76).
